caption:
// Tonight is one for all the frills//
â€¢â€¢â€¢
Gyoza lace
Accommodates 6 - 8 gyozas

100ml of water
2 TSP of flour
1 two cornstarch

Pan-fry your gyoza as per usual. Till it's crisp and golden brown on the bottom. Whisk the flour and water mixture in the ratios as stated above. Rest your pan on a dry towel for about 5 seconds before pouring in the batter and putting over medium heat. You'll want to put the lid on immediately and let steam for 4 minutes.

Once that is done. Take the lid off and allow for the extra water to evaporate off. Trickle a little sesame oil off the sides of the pan to allow for easy release.

Once most of the water have vanished. Remove from heat. Allow to cool on an insulated surface for about 1 minute before flipping it out onto a plate, as you would a upside down cake, i.e. plate inverted over cake and then flipping the entire pan over. Et voilÃ  !

caption:
çŒªè„šå¤è›‹ Braised pig trotters and egg ~ a 70s kind of luxury dish that still hands out lashings of comfort and gravy, hip-hugging action these days. Some of you might shy away from eating the offals (sheesh, you don't know what you're missing out on) but the pig intestines in there are the best parts. Hand me a bowl of white rice and nobody gets hurt.

Braised Pig trotters and egg
Makes enough for 5.

1.5 kg of pork feet. About 1 feet chopped into 10 - 12 pieces.
3 tablespoon dark soy sauce
10 cloves garlic
Black pepper
2 cloves
2 cinnamon sticks
Ginger 6 inches, chopped into 6 bits.
5 Hard boiled eggs
300g Pig Intestines

Prep your pig intestines, you want them cleaned and chopped into 4cm segments.

In some oil, stir-fry your ginger and de-skinned garlic cloves till fragrant. Add in the pork feet, black pepper and dark soy sauce. Cooking till the skin is taut and most of the liquids have evaporated.

Pour in enough water to submerge the trotters. Bring to a boil, add in the intestines, dried spices and hard -boiled eggs. Leave to simmer for at least an hour on the lowest heat possible.

Season to taste and serve on a platter accompanied with bowls of steaming white rice.

#sskitchendisasters #fundamentallyflawedkitchen #BudgetTenDollars #StayHomeWithAscott #food52 #pigtrotters

caption:
They say that "Cooking is about creating something delicious for someone else.". It's one thing to cook to pander to one's own cravings but to deal with your loved ones likes and dislikes... that's a different monster altogether.

My dad doesn't like chicken nor fatty pork, my little brother would plow through a whole bowl to excavate scallions and onions, my mother on the other hand is just a tough critique. If under usual circumstances, with this Hokkaido Pork Loin from @yakiniku_plaza, I would cook my favourite Katsudon and spam it with mirin soaked onions and chopped scallions overhead. Unfortunately, we had to settle for this tonkatsu-don which to be honest was elevated just merely by the pedigree of the pork. Lean yet tender simultaneously.

Meanwhile, let's talk Onsen Tamago â¡ï¸ scroll right for evidence. I've just learnt that you can make these without a sous-vide machine just based on the laws of thermodynamics. Listen up.

Onsen Tamago
Makes 4 luscious eggs

In a pot, bring 1 litre of water to a rolling boil. Remove from heat and place on an insulated surface. Tip in 200 ml of room temperature water straight from the tap.

Using a spoon, gently roll in 4 eggs straight from the fridge into the water. Put the lid on and set the timer for 17 minutes.

Remove from water and leave on a plate for 5 minutes. Crack and enjoy.

Note that large eggs were used in this recipe. Results may vary for medium eggs. Recipe: @justonecookbook

#sskitchendisasters #fundamentallyflawedkitchen #food52 #onsentamago

caption:
#SihanSayDaBaoWhat Mon Night edition: @tamashii_sg Sakura Buta Ramen.

Just as some stellar pastas require little flourishes to stand out amongst the crowd, a front-runner of a ramen doesn't need to sweat the condiments - the togarashi powder, the dreaded sweet corn, pools of black garlic oil, the mad sprinkling of allium. Instead, Tamashii's take-home rendition of the Pork Ramen allows you to play it up any way you like.

I did nothing, one because I'm lazy af, two because the broth on its own was smack with umami, enriched with trickles of yolk from the jammy eggs. Why mess with perfection?

caption:
My hunger to experience nature's spring to summer runway collection has manifested in something green (with envy). ğŸ’š Pandan Soft Milk Buns, the quintessential spring palette, and incredibly goregous to photograph too.

The recipe is up on @sulyntan 's profile and her recent #SoftMilkBunsClub movement has taken on a life of its own with netizen's scuttling in all directions, savoury with cheese and herbs, Milo chocolate filled buns and burger buns?!? It's a circus in there.

I followed the recipe to the tee except for the blending of 10 stalks of pandan leaves with the milk and sieving through for natural pandan flavoured milk. And stuffing each 54g of dough (made 9 buns instead of 16 which I baked in an 8" square tin) with 6g of Hainanese kaya. Second proofing was done in the cold depths of the fridge as I needed sleep and the thought of fresh bread in the morning was too alluring. Take it out of the fridge first thing in the morning and leave in a warm and draft-free place for about 40 minutes. Glaze with 1-egg + drizzle of milk 'egg-wash' and whack it in the 150Â°C oven. Would have done 50% coconut milk instead of milk but didn't have any to spare. All the more reason to revisit this recipe!

#sskitchendisasters #fundamentallyflawedkitchen #kayabun #BudgetTenDollars #StayHomeWithAscott

caption:
In the region of Brittany lies an island, Griox, a few kilometres of the main land. The 4.3km by 1.8km island enjoys a ultra mild micro-climate that draws in the tourists all year round. Once a major center of albacore tuna fishing, the island still boasts the livelihood of many skilled fishermen.

Groix & Nature (@groixetnature) is a boutique company that makes rillettes, cooked soups and dishes the traditional way. And trust you all know that I'm a big fan of fish rillette... But wait...their rillette range vary from Breton style scallop to whelk and even Mackerel with goat cheese. ğŸ¤¯ My fall-back, the salmon rillette is unctous, punctuated with just the right amount of fat to plump up good ole' olive oil grilled toasts. Fun and immediate.

Available via @classicdelisg. Use [10DELI] to enjoy 10% off.

#ClassicDeliSG #sskitchendisasters #fundamentallyflawedkitchen #StayHomeWithAscott

caption:
Don't be fooled by it's multi-components, 'oh-look-at-me, I'm so intimidating' appearance. {Ipoh Hor Fun} is actually very easy to put together for a huge party, in a methodical sense: prepare the soup base,  poach the chicken breast, fold some dumplings, cook off all the ingredients and it's done. But keep it to yourself -let others think you toiled for hours over this.

é¸¡ä¸è™¾æ²³ç²‰
Ingredients for 5

Broth
18 prawns - de-shelled, you just need the shell
Rock sugar
1 litre fish bone stock

15 IQF Frozen Tiger Prawns (from @tastegourmetmarket, use promo-code [SIHAN] to enjoy 5% off you entire cart)
Poached and Shredded chicken
Fried shallots
Greens
Sui Kow
Ipoh Hor Fun

Peel the prawns and reserve for dumpling-making. Fry the prawn heads and shells in oil till they turn red in colour. Add water and chicken parts and ikan bilis or prepared fish-bone stock. Simmer for at least an hour.

Strain the soup and transfer to a small pot.

Boil water in a wok and get ready a strainer. First put in your dumplings, these take a while to cook and don't do them in too large a batch to prevent them from sticking to one another. Blanch your Ipoh Hor Fun and leafy greens. Plate them up together with some shredded chicken (poached for 6 minutes in simmering broth/water and then switch off the heat and leave to continue cooking for another 15 mins) Cook your prawns in the boiling water for less than a minute.

Finally drench the hor fun with a few ladles of prawn broth and garnish the dish with fried shallots.

#sskitchendisasters #fundamentallyflawedkitchen

caption:
It's not a secret anymore. ::Burrata grilled cheese sandwich::. Things will never be the same again.

Tips: You'll want to lay the burrata on a paper towel first to soak up the extra water. Tear open your needed piece of Burrata to reveal the creamy innards before laying on the bread. Layer on some sliced cherry tomatoes and dried herbs. Then slap on some more burrata for good times. Making sure to season with pepper and salt along the way.

Also, mayo is your best friend if you want some legit grilled cheesus. That and low and slow. Can't hurry a princess can you? Anyway, Happy Sunday y'all.

caption:
Fitted in some extra kitchen time this afternoon after tackling lunch to roll out these Kueh Dadar. Took a little motivation but I rolled up my sleeves and got to work on these green scrolls in the end. Ah yes, green ğŸ’š, you don't see a lot of that on my feed. That's because nothing really photogenic comes out of it. Wait, actually scratch that: avocado on toast, matcha molten lava cake, green curry. Too soon to speak.

Back to the Kueh Dadar, these are self-indulgent affairs, worthy of brewing that most expensive pot of Oolong tea to accompany it with.

Kueh Dadar
Makes 8 rolls

200g plain flour
15 pandan leaves + 160ml water
200ml coconut milk (thick)
50ml water
1 egg
1 TSP oil
Pinch of salt

120g gula melaka
50ml water
5 pandan leaves knotted together
300g freshly grated coconut

Prepare the filling first. In a pot, place gula melaka, water and the knotted pandan leaves together. Heat up till the sugar completely dissolves and bubbles slightly. Pop in your grated coconut and stir to ensure that all the sugar syrup is absorbed and it is uniformly coloured a caramel brown. Set aside in a warm place.

Prepare the batter. Blitz the snipped up pandan leaves and water together till you get a slurry. Sieve that through a fine mesh sieve, making sure to press out all the remaining pandan juices. Combine the pandan juice with flour, salt, coconut milk, water, egg, oil and salt in a deep bowl. Whisk together to get a nice smooth green batter.

Heat up your pan. I used an 8 inch based pan. Dab the bottom thoroughly with oil. When the pan is about medium heat, pour in a ladle of batter and swirl slightly to get an even layer. Cook for about 2 minutes on one side before flipping over and finishing for another minute on the other.

Set on a wooden board, fill it nicely with just the right amount of coconut filling, and roll up nice and tight. Serve warm.

Send me some green lovin' ğŸ’šğŸ’šğŸ’š, if you're into this. 
#fundamentallyflawedkitchen #sskitchendisasters #food52 #StayHomeWithAscott

caption:
I had started working with Big Fish Small Fish prior to circuit breaker to create an affordable fish and chips experience where you can get a good variety of fish fried in a thin and crisp batter. I like them because they are one of the few places where you get to choose from a range of fish like Haddock, Halibut, Hoki, Salmon, Dory, Seabass etc.

With the gradual lifting of the CB, you can finally head down to experience the menu! Read my review and find out which is my favorite fish here: https://bit.ly/ieatbigifshsmallfish

Big Fish Small Fish is at 5 locations around Singapore: 
Punggol container Park, Tampines Mall, Northpoint City, JCube & Bugis Junction

#sp #bigfishsmallfishsg #fishandchips #fishandchipssg @bigfishsmallfishsg

caption:
Since itâ€™s Fatherâ€™s Day, the family agreed to make a trip to Sin Ming for prata. http://bit.ly/ieatAzizPrata. But as it turns out, phase 2 is still not the best time to eat at a coffeeshop! There were not enough tables available and the queue was super long! 
We ended up at the nearby Cafe Zeppin http://bit.ly/iEatSinMing which was still quiet as this is the first time they are opened on Sunday. They surprised me with a nice cup of cappuccino with a face on it (I think itâ€™s supposed to be me!) with the words â€œSuper Heroâ€ on it. Nice touch! I would like to share it with all my fellow Fatherâ€™s out there! Continue to be a Super Hero for your family! 
There wasnâ€™t much of a choice for brunch so we ended up with their Lu  Rou fan and other small bites! Now that they are opened on Sunday, they will be rolling out a brunch menu in the coming weeks. Itâ€™s a cozy little cafe and we always wnjoy the hospitality of the lao ban niang (Phoebe) there! Just looking forward to simple things like French toast, bacon, sausage, eggs and pancakes! For lunch and dinner, the lu rou fan and seafood soup are very good. They import their own soy sauce from Taiwan for authenticity.

caption:
Here are the Special Father's Day sets from Peach Garden in case you are planning for something special this Sunday.  We have a special 10% discount promocode: <ieatishootipost10> for you if you order on 16 & 17 June here- https://bit.ly/ieatpeachgarden

I got to try all the dishes in both sets and they are very good, which can be expected of Peach Garden.  The highlights for me were the Chilli Crabs.  The crabs were large and solid and the chilli sauce was very well balanced without being too spicy.  It was the best Chilli Crabs I have had in recent memory.  The Braised Soon Hock with crispy pork was also excellent. The fish was substantial and the sauce was shiok.  I also liked both the Peking Duck and Crispy London Duck with dang gui sauce. The sets come with 5 main dishes and you also get to choose 3 complimentary items like a bottle of red wine, longevity buns, orh nee, Asparagus with Scallops etc.  They arrived in insulated red bags which was very impressive and one of the dishes also came in a claypot! 
Don't wait to the last minute to order.  They currently have FREE delivery island-wide. 
You may also call to order with the 10% promocode <ieatishootipost10> at any of their branches:
PG @ OCBC Centre: 6535 7833
PG @ Thomson Plaza: 6451 3233
PG @ Hotel Miramar: 6736 3833
PG @ The Metropolis: 6334 7833
PG @ Chinatown Point: 6702 0603

Remember that the promocode is valid on 16 & 17 June only so mai tu liao!
#sp @peachgardensg

caption:
Very productive day in the kitchen today! I singlehandedly cooked Ayam Buah Keluak, Babi Assam and Prawn Sambal Bostador! 
How was I able to do this? The secret is that all the ingredients came ready packed as a DIY kit from Eurasian restaurant, Quentinâ€™s. http://bit.ly/ieatQuentins

The buah keluak was already soaked and cracked opened! It really saved me the effort of going down to Tekka market a week ahead to buy and soak the buah keluak and then cracking them open one at a time. The sambal was already made and the lemongrass and shallots are sliced and portioned exactly! Even the chicken was already chopped to the right size! All I needed to do was the final step of putting everything together! 
All three dishes were well proportioned and the ingredients were good quality. I didnâ€™t need to add anything else except a little sugar to balance out the sourness of the Assam and all three dishes were delicious! 
Do check out their cooking kits here! https://bit.ly/ieatquentinskits

Quentinâ€™s is one of the last Eurasian restaurants around preserving our least understood  Heritage cuisine! So please support! @quentinssg 
#mediadrop

caption:
Lunch today is from our friends at Diamond Kitchen. I wrote about these passionate Gen Y Zi Charpreneurs a few years back. http://bit.ly/ieatdiamondkitchen. 
Their food is very good quality and they still go to buy the seafood from Jurong fishery port themselves 3 times a week to ensure freshness and quality.  They currently have a crab promo. 3x500g crabs cooked in any style for $49.90 which is about the price that I pay for crabs at the market! I tried several flavours and I like their black pepper the best. The crabs are quite solid. They are also having a promo on their whole seabass at $12.90 per fish. I also liked their beef hor fun which has the requisite wok hei. Their signature is their lala beehoon which has the sweetness of clam jus in it. It could have been better if the beehoon was more charred. Overall it was a very good meal! 
Check out their menu here: https://bit.ly/ieatdiamonmenu
WhatsApp: +65 96627600

caption:
Ever tried making Mee Pok Tar at home? I think many have tried making it like how the hawkers do it and have given up because it really is not practical to cook one bowl at a time for a family of five!

In this video, I show you how to make Mee Pok Tar for sharing just like how you would with spaghetti bolognese! To make it really authentic, I am using ingredients from Li Xin Teochew Fishball noodles whcih you can order directly from: https://bit.ly/ieatlixinnoodles

Their fishballs are made with pure yellowtail fish and has that texture that is very different from the fishballs you buy from the supermarket. Their her giao and fish rolls are still being made by hand. You can also order ready made pork lard and chilli which are very good quality and only $4 for a big tub. It really is cheaper than making myself! 
#sp @lixinfishball

caption: Our Hainanese pioneers really hit upon something special when they used crushed cream crackers to coat their pork chops. The crackers give an extra dimension of toasty flavour to the pork chops that make them really irresistible! We used pork collar instead of pork loin today and it really gave it a nice chewy and juicy bite! Hereâ€™s the recipe: http://bit.ly/ieatPorkChops. NB if you want to use the air fryer, you need to spray some oil to your crushed crackers and toast them slightly first before coating the pork. Then air fry or oven bake them. It will work as well!

caption:
My Pau quest continues! Todayâ€™s Pau come from Mdm Ling Bakery http://bit.ly/ieatMdmLing which is another place recommended by our readers. Those of you who love Tau Sar Pau would immediately recognize this style of Tau Sar Pau made famous by Forty Hands. Since they were introduced years back, these paus have been popping up in Singapore in various places. They are actually imported from JB and they are recognized by their distinctive flat disc shape and smooth tau sar. At 6 for $7.90, they actually cost more than our local variety but no one is complaining as they are less than half the price of the ones sold at the cafe!

I think they are nice but to be honest, these paus have never really blown me away. However, the skin is light and fluffy and their 8 hr slow cooked, de-hulled tau sar is smooth and not too sweet. I have always been prejudiced by their factory made look, but they do stand out as a tau sar pau which is easily recognizable. Sadly, our local tau sar pau are all pretty generic except for perhaps the ones at Joo Huat  http://bit.ly/ieatJooHuatPau who still make their own tau sar. Their Liu Sar paus are also quite nice, albeit also looking very factory made. The salted egg custard is runny and quite nice. 
They are available online and Mdm Ling Bakery also import cookies from Malaysia which you might like to check out at their website.

#mediadrop

caption:
Since itâ€™s Fatherâ€™s Day, the family agreed to make a trip to Sin Ming for prata. http://bit.ly/ieatAzizPrata. But as it turns out, phase 2 is still not the best time to eat at a coffeeshop! There were not enough tables available and the queue was super long! 
We ended up at the nearby Cafe Zeppin http://bit.ly/iEatSinMing which was still quiet as this is the first time they are opened on Sunday. They surprised me with a nice cup of cappuccino with a face on it (I think itâ€™s supposed to be me!) with the words â€œSuper Heroâ€ on it. Nice touch! I would like to share it with all my fellow Fatherâ€™s out there! Continue to be a Super Hero for your family! 
There wasnâ€™t much of a choice for brunch so we ended up with their Lu  Rou fan and other small bites! Now that they are opened on Sunday, they will be rolling out a brunch menu in the coming weeks. Itâ€™s a cozy little cafe and we always wnjoy the hospitality of the lao ban niang (Phoebe) there! Just looking forward to simple things like French toast, bacon, sausage, eggs and pancakes! For lunch and dinner, the lu rou fan and seafood soup are very good. They import their own soy sauce from Taiwan for authenticity.

caption:
Here are the Special Father's Day sets from Peach Garden in case you are planning for something special this Sunday.  We have a special 10% discount promocode: <ieatishootipost10> for you if you order on 16 & 17 June here- https://bit.ly/ieatpeachgarden

I got to try all the dishes in both sets and they are very good, which can be expected of Peach Garden.  The highlights for me were the Chilli Crabs.  The crabs were large and solid and the chilli sauce was very well balanced without being too spicy.  It was the best Chilli Crabs I have had in recent memory.  The Braised Soon Hock with crispy pork was also excellent. The fish was substantial and the sauce was shiok.  I also liked both the Peking Duck and Crispy London Duck with dang gui sauce. The sets come with 5 main dishes and you also get to choose 3 complimentary items like a bottle of red wine, longevity buns, orh nee, Asparagus with Scallops etc.  They arrived in insulated red bags which was very impressive and one of the dishes also came in a claypot! 
Don't wait to the last minute to order.  They currently have FREE delivery island-wide. 
You may also call to order with the 10% promocode <ieatishootipost10> at any of their branches:
PG @ OCBC Centre: 6535 7833
PG @ Thomson Plaza: 6451 3233
PG @ Hotel Miramar: 6736 3833
PG @ The Metropolis: 6334 7833
PG @ Chinatown Point: 6702 0603

Remember that the promocode is valid on 16 & 17 June only so mai tu liao!
#sp @peachgardensg

caption:
Very productive day in the kitchen today! I singlehandedly cooked Ayam Buah Keluak, Babi Assam and Prawn Sambal Bostador! 
How was I able to do this? The secret is that all the ingredients came ready packed as a DIY kit from Eurasian restaurant, Quentinâ€™s. http://bit.ly/ieatQuentins

The buah keluak was already soaked and cracked opened! It really saved me the effort of going down to Tekka market a week ahead to buy and soak the buah keluak and then cracking them open one at a time. The sambal was already made and the lemongrass and shallots are sliced and portioned exactly! Even the chicken was already chopped to the right size! All I needed to do was the final step of putting everything together! 
All three dishes were well proportioned and the ingredients were good quality. I didnâ€™t need to add anything else except a little sugar to balance out the sourness of the Assam and all three dishes were delicious! 
Do check out their cooking kits here! https://bit.ly/ieatquentinskits

Quentinâ€™s is one of the last Eurasian restaurants around preserving our least understood  Heritage cuisine! So please support! @quentinssg 
#mediadrop

caption:
Lunch today is from our friends at Diamond Kitchen. I wrote about these passionate Gen Y Zi Charpreneurs a few years back. http://bit.ly/ieatdiamondkitchen. 
Their food is very good quality and they still go to buy the seafood from Jurong fishery port themselves 3 times a week to ensure freshness and quality.  They currently have a crab promo. 3x500g crabs cooked in any style for $49.90 which is about the price that I pay for crabs at the market! I tried several flavours and I like their black pepper the best. The crabs are quite solid. They are also having a promo on their whole seabass at $12.90 per fish. I also liked their beef hor fun which has the requisite wok hei. Their signature is their lala beehoon which has the sweetness of clam jus in it. It could have been better if the beehoon was more charred. Overall it was a very good meal! 
Check out their menu here: https://bit.ly/ieatdiamonmenu
WhatsApp: +65 96627600

caption:
Ever tried making Mee Pok Tar at home? I think many have tried making it like how the hawkers do it and have given up because it really is not practical to cook one bowl at a time for a family of five!

In this video, I show you how to make Mee Pok Tar for sharing just like how you would with spaghetti bolognese! To make it really authentic, I am using ingredients from Li Xin Teochew Fishball noodles whcih you can order directly from: https://bit.ly/ieatlixinnoodles

Their fishballs are made with pure yellowtail fish and has that texture that is very different from the fishballs you buy from the supermarket. Their her giao and fish rolls are still being made by hand. You can also order ready made pork lard and chilli which are very good quality and only $4 for a big tub. It really is cheaper than making myself! 
#sp @lixinfishball

caption: Our Hainanese pioneers really hit upon something special when they used crushed cream crackers to coat their pork chops. The crackers give an extra dimension of toasty flavour to the pork chops that make them really irresistible! We used pork collar instead of pork loin today and it really gave it a nice chewy and juicy bite! Hereâ€™s the recipe: http://bit.ly/ieatPorkChops. NB if you want to use the air fryer, you need to spray some oil to your crushed crackers and toast them slightly first before coating the pork. Then air fry or oven bake them. It will work as well!

caption:
My Pau quest continues! Todayâ€™s Pau come from Mdm Ling Bakery http://bit.ly/ieatMdmLing which is another place recommended by our readers. Those of you who love Tau Sar Pau would immediately recognize this style of Tau Sar Pau made famous by Forty Hands. Since they were introduced years back, these paus have been popping up in Singapore in various places. They are actually imported from JB and they are recognized by their distinctive flat disc shape and smooth tau sar. At 6 for $7.90, they actually cost more than our local variety but no one is complaining as they are less than half the price of the ones sold at the cafe!

I think they are nice but to be honest, these paus have never really blown me away. However, the skin is light and fluffy and their 8 hr slow cooked, de-hulled tau sar is smooth and not too sweet. I have always been prejudiced by their factory made look, but they do stand out as a tau sar pau which is easily recognizable. Sadly, our local tau sar pau are all pretty generic except for perhaps the ones at Joo Huat  http://bit.ly/ieatJooHuatPau who still make their own tau sar. Their Liu Sar paus are also quite nice, albeit also looking very factory made. The salted egg custard is runny and quite nice. 
They are available online and Mdm Ling Bakery also import cookies from Malaysia which you might like to check out at their website.

caption:
Who else loves to eat Pau? Over the years, the bad news is that the quality of our paus seem to be on the decline. I used to like Teck Kee but they are gone. But even before they closed, the quality was already quite bad: http://bit.ly/ieatTeckKeePau. Tiong Bahru Pau used to be really good http://bit.ly/ieattiongbahrupau, but quality has also declined over the years. Thankfully Tanjong Rhu Pau is still good, though I find the skin is not as tender and as thin as before. The little charsiu paus are very good and has that requisite charcoal flavour. http://bit.ly/ieattanjongrhupau. 
Are there any places you can recommend for a really good big Pau?  I am hoping someone would bring our Pau to the next level and help arrest the decline.

caption:
Had an amazing lunch today from Michelin Star Chef Han Li Guang of Labyrinth. They have just launched Miss Vanda which is their online platform for their takeaway menu. The food is prepared at their kitchen at Labyrinth by the same culinary team.  The two outstanding dishes today were the Wagyu Rendang Buah Keluak which uses Wagyu intercostals braised till fork tender and cooked in a mild rendang gravy and bua keluak purÃ©e. It is the best thing that has been delivered to our doorstep since CB started. Their laksa is also really good. Definitely a notch above the hawker version. Itâ€™s chock full of seafood like prawns, scallop dumplings  and mussels and the gravy is full of dried prawns, aromatic rempah, laksa leaves and freshly squeezed coconut. The har cheong gai would have been excellent fresh but they were already soft when they arrived, but the surprise was that they have been deboned, so it was really easy to eat. The chicken rice was the only dish I felt ambivalent about. Donâ€™t compare it with the local version as it is supposed to be a claypot â€œANG MOHâ€ version that his grandma used to make which comes with a creamy mushroom sauce that tasted a bit like Chicken Ala King. 
Overall, the quality of the food is very good. The team are doing a great job making ultimate versions of our local dishes. Yes, they are more expensive than the hawker version but it wouldnâ€™t be fair to compare their pricing with the hawkers. Instead, you should compare the laksa with a plate of pasta then you will be able to see itâ€™s true value! 
You can order their dishes from http://bit.ly/ieatMsVanda

caption:
Had a sudden hankering for Wantons today! I am referring to the local version which is filled with small,  bite sized minced pork â€” the type they serve with wanton mee. After boiling, I just toss them in a bit of shallot oil to prevent sticking, and a dash of light soy sauce. Bit like eating ravioli! Itâ€™s really a meal by itself! 
I have been toying with the perfect wanton recipe (the local type, not the HK type) for a while now. The filling has to be mainly pork with a flavour you just have to keep eating. Today I seasoned the pork with fried white pepper and salt, fried sole fish powder, oil, Chinese wine, cornflour and water. For a better bite, I added extra diced pork fat. Quite close, but can still improve. Water chestnut is not in the recipe as I feel it will turn it into a sui gao instead. Any other suggestions are most welcome!

caption:
Here's a recipe that is perfect for those of you who are beginner cooks! It's inspired by the scrambled egg sandwich that is so popular in Hong Kong! Unlike the Western style scrambled eggs, this method results in layers of tender, velvety and really yummy eggs which is just perfect in a sandwich with luncheon meat and a cup of kopi/tea! Recipe here: bit.ly/ieatScrambleEggs

If you haven't started cooking yet, what are you waiting for? All you need is two eggs, butter, salt and a pan. You can even omit the cornflour slurry if you don't have it handy!

Which brand of luncheon meat would you recommend?

[ FACEBOOK LIVE SALE 26 JUNE (FRIDAY) 8.30PM ] You never want to miss this Facebook Live Sale because we are working with @cpfoodssg to bring you some convenient ready-to-cook products from Kitchen Joy and Benja Chicken.

You can flex your new cooking skills with #KitchenJoyâ€™s high-quality items such as Charcoal Grilled Teriyaki Chicken in Skewers, Fried Fish Slice, Charcoal Grilled Inner Fillet, Edamame Roots, Sliced Lotus Roots, Rapeseed Flower Leafy Vegetables and more.

It is so convenient it is to have fish soup noodle / vegetables at home without much prepartion. All items are pre-slice and pre-wash, thus it saves you lot of prep time. Plus you can even enjoy authentic Japanese charcoal-grilled teriyaki sticks in mins just by heating.

Donâ€™t forget to also grab brown rice-fed chicken from @benjachickensingapore. This is the preferred chicken used in michelin star restaurants in Thailand. They are raised without hormones and antibiotics, and are tender and more juicy. It is available in chicken griller (whole chicken), skinless boneless breast, skinless boneless leg, and skin-on boneless leg.

Free delivery for purchases above $65. Plus, we will be giving away FREE Kitchen Joy Burger Set with a minimum spending of $75. It is going to be exciting! See you this Friday 8.30pm!

Over the past few months, burnt cheesecake has become the darling of our local dessert scene. You see them in a lot of restaurants. Now, sister duo @fiftygramss has perfected their Basque burnt cheesecake recipe and are selling it online! â£
â£
Their burnt cheesecake features a beautifully caramelized bruÌ‚leÌed crust. It adds a mysterious, but highly enjoyable, flavour akin to salted caramel. I cut a slice for myself, savouring it from the burnt crust, to the velvety smooth centre. As compared to many other cheesecakes I have tried, their version is a lot richer and gloriously cheesier! â£
â£
It can be eaten immediately (if you desire that lava effect) or you can store it in the fridge for two hours before diving into it. You can also pair it with a dollop of cream. Too easy to love! Whatsapp 9711 3198 to order.

caption:
We had a feast from @shaoparadise, a hawker stall in Amoy Street Food Centre run by a 70-year-old uncle. Despite being an amputee and having gone through bypass surgery, he still goes to the stall daily to cook. The tender steamed chicken comes dressed with sesame oil, and goes well with its bowl of chicken rice. Beyond that, the chilli sauce also packs a tangy punch. No doubt, this is the thing that makes the chicken rice meal. â£
â£
Anything with their signature Thai chilli sauce is a must-order. We had the Thai tofu and Thai style gizzard. It is sweet, savory, tangy and spicy, the thick consistency makes this sauce the perfect compliment. Honestly, I was asking if they can bottle up this sauce. â£
â£
Donâ€™t forget to pair your meal with their shrimp dumpling soup. Wrapped with fresh shrimp, minced meat and crunchy water chestnut, the plump dumpling was packed generously with ingredients and every bite made me crave another. â£
â£
I had multiple servings of their Black Vinegar Pig Trotters. The tender, gelatinous pork trotters is beautifully simmered in the aromatic yet pungent sweet and sour black vinegar.â£
â£
Bentos are available as well. Islandwide delivery available. Whatsapp 97697868â£ to order! â£

caption:
Dinner last night was from @missvandasg, the delivery arm of @restaurantlabyrinth. I was pretty excited because @han_lg is always reinterpreting traditions. â£
â£
One of the offerings on Miss Vanda is the Labyrinth signature â€œAng Mohâ€ Chicken Rice. Chef Hanâ€™s grandma used to work as landlady and housekeeper cooking for a British family. Hence, this is her version of the quintessential Hainanese Chicken Rice. The aromatic chicken rice is served with juicy free range Kampong chicken and creamy chicken and mushroom sauce, complete with the nicely charred crispy rice bits. This is like the Singaporean risotto. â£
â£
We love the Wagyu Buah Keluak Rendang. They slow braised it overnight, hence it is so tender. And the flavours are enriched with buah keluak, which is known as Asiaâ€™s truffle.â£
â£
Their Seafood Laksa is super rich and creamy. It is served with grilled Argentinian red prawns,  local green lip mussels, homemade fish paste and crabmeat dumplings. We also had the boneless Crispy Har Cheong Chicken Wings and Hainanese Style Sweet and Sour Sakura Pork Tomahawk.â£
â£
Donâ€™t forget to get a bottle of Hainanese Kaya for breakfast the next day. It is made with fresh coconut milk, local organic free range eggs and young pandan leaves, gently stirred for over 2-3 hours. â£
â£
Minimum spending is $50. They are open 7 days a week and they do islandwide delivery at $10 flat fee no matter where you stay or work. Self pick is also available, at Esplanade Mall 02-23. â£
â£
Order from www.missvanda.sg today!

.
I tried their newest addition, the Umami Soy Chirashi (S$17.80) and Iâ€™m loving every bit of this umami filled goodness. With the reddish-orange balls of huge salmon roe scattered amongst the diced sashimi, the bowl was a playground of texture and flavours, waiting to be devoured! - @fel_z

caption:
Today, weâ€™re trying out a crowd-favourite recipe that we found on @shermainexk Instagram post. Itâ€™s easy, flaky, and super addictive - this Easy Air Fryer Egg Tarts recipe will have you lining your Tupperware with egg custard pastries for days.
.
I used brown sugar instead of regular white sugar, and the resulting egg tarts had a good amount of caramel smokiness to them. Using frozen prata to replace the typical shortcrust tart shell is certainly a stroke of genius, because it reduces the preparation time by a lot.
.
This recipe makes egg tarts that are closer in taste and texture to Portuguese egg tarts, with a flaky, crispy crust and smooth, egg custard centre. If you have an air fryer at home, pick up a pack of frozen prata from the supermarket and try out this simple recipe. Share your experience with us! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Hidden away at Forum Galleria Orchard Road, @brownbutter.sg sits comfortably between its cousin restaurants, Hana Japanese Restaurant and The Benjamin Browns. Of course, I had to try Brown Butterâ€™s insta-famous desserts. Shaped cheekily like a cartoon block of cheese, I loved the attention to detail with the little holes on the Lemon Cheesecake.
.
Priced at S$8.90+, I felt that it was a little exorbitant for a small slice of cake. The difference between these cakes and other cheesecakes is easily spotted.
.
Instead of having a crunchy biscuit base attached to the cake, these cakes came without a base and sat atop biscuits crumbs scattered in an artfully careless manner. Have you tried the desserts at Brown Butter Cafe yet? ~ @stercei

caption:

.
The Mala Lamb Shawarma was exceptionally fiery â€“ together with the juicy, gamey lamb meat, the tongue-tingling mala spices made me break out in a sweat. You can also get these mala flavours in their Signature Rolls, Salads and Rice Boxes.
.

Feeling in need of something comforting and soothing? Warm yourself up with a piping bowl of frog leg porridge!
.
Fight off the gloom with the sizzling fragrance of tender frog legs immersed in silky, warm porridge. Apart from their immensely comforting congee, @g7liveseafood offers seafood delights and a myriad of zi char dishes.
.
The Marmite Pork Ribs also deserves a mention; crispy ribs coated in a thick sticky, sweet and savoury glaze make this side dish an unbeatable choice. ~ @jermtard

caption:
I think you have to agree that there is nothing better than ice cream. Rain or shine, a pint of ice cream is always welcome.
.
This effortless 3-ingredient recipe promises ice cream that's just as good as what you get in the store. I was pretty impressed with how thick, creamy and rich this ice cream turned out - and all without an ice cream maker.
.
Not to mention, the speculoos with its caramel notes was just the icing on the cake - a dream for all the sweet tooths out there. This recipe is so simple and customisable that you can make essentially make any flavour you like.
.
The world is your ice cream flavour, so try this recipe out and tell us what you would make your ice cream with! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Nestled under a block of flats in the quiet estate of Pandan Gardens is @ahhuateochewnoodle.
.
Helmed by a father-daughter team, this is unlike your usual Teochew fishball noodles. Their speciality Homemade Fuzhou Fishball With Rice Needle Noodles (S$3) might be a tad monochromatic but packs huge flavour.
.
Served with rice needle noodles (more commonly known as lao shu fen), a medley of springy fishballs, prized herh kiao and a couple of Ah Hua Teochew Fishball Noodle unique creations, I was slurping every last bit of these noodles.
.
Though not located in the most accessible place, I have to say that Ah Hua Teochew Fishball Noodle will make it worth your while. ~@bunny2302

caption:
When staying at home for an extended period of time gets you down, I'm sure you're like me and seek comfort in food. @thecommunalplace Pancake Tower (S$16) will put a smile on your face instantly with its three-layered fluffy goodness that comes with maple syrup and a generous scattering of cookie crumbles, blueberries, and strawberries.
.
They are thick, and airy, with just the right amount of sweetness, so you won't feel the need to drizzle too much maple syrup just to enjoy it! If you haven't tried them yet, order today with their islandwide delivery service and current 2-for-1 promotion. ~ @waniology

caption:
Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry Rice puts all other Hainanese curry rice stalls to shame. A luscious and satisfying curry that's messily ladled over a plate of rice, this hits the spot alright. It's a little thinner than most curry dishes but twice as good.
.
Another item that you have to get on your plate is Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry Rice's Crispy Pork. These moreish rashers are crispy to a fault and dangerously addictive, providing a delightful savoury crunch to pair with your rice.
.
Besides the Crispy Pork, Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry also has fantastic meat and vegetable selections that are just as good! At an affordable price point, No Name Hainanese Curry Rice surely lives up to its name, or lack thereof. ~@ bunny2302

caption:
Dalgona coffee is a bonafide hit of 2020; even more so with its fluffy and velvety smooth texture. This time, we'll be taking things up a notch. Inspired by the viral drink, we have made a no-churn version of Dalgona-inspired Ice Cream loaded with delicious toffee bits. .
A memorable treat you won't soon forget, this combination is a match made in heaven. Rich, creamy and decadent, the ice cream melts in your mouth with mellow sweetness and a deep coffee flavour.
.
Coupled with a hint of caramel crunchiness from the toffee bits, I'm sure this dessert will "mocha" you crazy! ~ @jermtard

caption:
In the Whampoa Makan Place, there's a gem that is replete with history. @matasohsg dates back to the 1950s, where hawker life was as rustic as it gets.
.
With handmade fishball and meatballs that are made with 100% yellowtail fish, that makes all the difference, trust me. Their Soh Special (S$4.50/S$5.50) is worth the trip down. A wobbly onsen egg, al dente noodles coupled with those springy and bouncy fishballs - it's a perfect meal if I do say so myself. Make the trip down to Whampoa Makan Place and try it out for yourself! ~@bunny2302

caption:
Impress your friends and family with one of @bobthebakerboyâ€™s out-of-the-box cake designs, like this Defying Gravity Floating Beer Can Cake (from S$138). You can add on tiers, change the colour and the brand as well as the flavour of the cake itself, according to your fancy. But most importantly, itâ€™s one of the best-tasting cakes Iâ€™ve had in a long time!
.
This one was made with Belgian Chocolate and the layers were moist and soft, without overwhelming the tastebuds. Their cakes are also made with lower sugar, so itâ€™s healthier than your regular store-bought cake. Take it from me, as someone who canâ€™t get enough of cake; this one is a treat youâ€™ll want to take your time to savour! #sp ~@waniology

caption:
@lovehandleburgers isn't just any vegan burger spot; their burgers start from only S$10 and are packed with bold flavours - not something you'd expect from a vegan place.
.
Their Double Cheeseburger (S$17) consists of two layers of Impossibleâ„¢ patties, two slices of melted vegan cheese, caramelised onions, burger sauce, and pickles. The homemade brioche buns remained exceptionally firm, despite the journey during delivery.
.
Sink your teeth into one of the creations now, as they're available for islandwide delivery with only a S$10 delivery fee! Note that there's S$30 minimum spending. ~ @waniology

caption:
For most of us working professionals, a cup of coffee is never far from our caffeine-dependent hands. As a coffee fiend who canâ€™t do without my daily cuppa, I was delighted to takethe Bootstrap Mix Pack (S$35) from @bootstrapcoldbrewsg for a spin.
.
My favourite drink from the pack had to be the Bootstrap Cold Brew Milk & Manuka Honey. The manuka honey brought out the velvety smooth sweetness in the coffee and milk, and smoothed over most of the bitter edge from the coffee.
.
This is a classic white coffee, but with a twist. Bootstrap Beveragesâ€™ signature cold brew comes with creamy 100% fresh milk, and the floral sweetness of organic New Zealand manuka honey - it has natural healing properties!
.
Coffee or tea, Bootstrap Beveragesâ€™ cold brewing technique certainly brings out the best in the beans and leaves. Ready for an awesome perk-me-up? #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
In the gleaming white-washed walls of Maxwell Chambers sits @dumplings.ru , a Russian restaurant serving authentic Russian delights that are sure to charm you.
.
Well, if you are a little nervous about diving headfirst into the depth of Russian cuisine don't worry, these colourful dumplings are a wonderful introduction. With robust and tasty filling such as beef, lamb and even potato and bacon, these are simply scrumptious.
.
Perfect for lunch and dinner, you can even dip your toes and order a Ukrainian Borscht (S$8.50) while you're at it. Fusion Dumplings puts on no airs and trust me, you'll find yourself liking Russian food before you know it! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Out of eggs? You can still make a chocolatey dessert, with this Mayonnaise Chocolate Cake recipe. The thought of putting savoury mayonnaise in sweet chocolate cake might seem really gross to most, but I gave it a try to see how it turns out.
.
This cake is much fluffier, with a decent crumb pattern that made it like a chocolatey sponge cake. Itâ€™s a little stickier on the bottom, almost like sticky date pudding.
.
The baking does yield a rather large cake, but you canâ€™t ever have too much chocolate cake, after all. Share the love with your family and friends - and maybe only reveal the secret ingredient to them after theyâ€™ve showered you with praises for your baking prowess.
.
If youâ€™re intrigued by this recipe, why not give it a try? Let us know if this strange ingredient substitution works for you too. ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
If you like zi char, then you've probably heard about @kengengkee. A household name, you'll know you're in for a good time when you order from KEK Seafood, so I ordered their Family Set D (S$116) that's good for four to six people.
.
The highlight of the set has to be their signature Moonlight Hor Fun that came with moon-like egg yolks intact when delivered, poised in the middle of the fried noodles. Break the egg and you'll get hor fun covered in a velvety, silky sauce with moreish, fatty slices of lap cheong and lard.
.
Other dishes I would recommend would be the Coffee Ribs and the Salted Egg Prawns. Moreover, KEK Seafood is so generous with their portions you'll have yummy leftovers for days. Order up a feast from KEK Seafood and trust me you won't be disappointed! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Our favourite @mcdsg may have finally returned to us after a brief hiatus, but some things money still canâ€™t buy. Yes, Iâ€™m talking about the seasonal and very much beloved Prosperity Burger from McDonaldâ€™s. Well, to save us the heartache of pining for this seasonal burger, hereâ€™s a recipe for DIY McDonaldâ€™s Prosperity Burger, in just 30 minutes!
.
While the sliced onions are added raw, like how McDonaldâ€™s does it, feel free to grill the onions very lightly if thatâ€™s your preference. Personally, I find the sharp, pungent bite from raw sliced onions provides an additional dimension to the burger.

caption:
Those of us who enjoy Asian desserts would be used to sweet potatoes. From sweet potato sesame balls, to bubur cha cha, these starchy roots add lots of chewy bite to our favourite sweet treats.
.
Letâ€™s explore a different side of desserts and sweet treats, with Anthony Bourdainâ€™s Candied Sweet Potatoes with Bourbon.
.
Together with the bourbon sauce, it was an absolute delight. The butter and sugar in the sauce left a creamy mouthfeel, while a hint of tartness from the apple cider played on my palate. The alcohol content from the bourbon and cider wouldâ€™ve burnt off during the cooking process, so all thatâ€™s left of the bourbon was mostly deep notes of caramel, vanilla and molasses.
.
Try it, and let us know how it goes! ~ @colourmemamused

caption:
Whip up your very own Canadian dish at home during this #StayHome period with our homemade Canadian Poutine recipe!

Using ingredients we can find in Singapore, this is probably as authentic as it gets. Seeing the end product was absolutely satisfying for me because I loved every aspect of the dish. The way the warm, dark, ambrosial gravy trickled down the fries and chunks of cheese whetted my appetite as soon as I poured the gravy over this delightful meal.

I especially liked how the heat of the gravy melted the cheese, making it look appetising and stringy. The fries were cooked to a crisp golden-brown and I was glad I decided to cook them without peeling the potato skin.

Have you tried Canadian poutine before? ~ @stercei

caption:
What if I told you that you, too, could cook and bake like famous chefs? We may not be able to match his skill in crafting intricate desserts, but at least we can put together this easy yet scrumptious chocolate cake, as seen from @pierrehermeofficialâ€™s Instagram post.

Pierre HermÃ©â€™s 5-Ingredient Chocolate Cake recipe is simple enough, and yields an absolutely heavenly cake. Imagine the soft, crumbly texture of butter cookies, but with the rich, decadent bittersweet notes of dark chocolate.

You might even want to pair your chocolate cake with the most classic of accompaniments: vanilla ice cream. Creamy and cold to the warm and crumbly chocolate cake, this is sure to sate even the direst dessert cravings.

If you leave it in the fridge overnight, it gets a lot denser and more fudgey. Mmm, delicious.

Want to feel like a famous pastry chef for a day? Try this 5-Ingredient Chocolate Cake recipe, and share your experience with us! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
[GIVEAWAY] There is no better news than hearing that KFC's Zinger Double Down has returned to us and even better, it's back with a twist. Presenting: the Mozzarella Zinger Double Down that features the same tantalising Zinger fillets but this time with a chunky, golden mozzarella patty in between. That's not all, these Zinger fillets are slathered with a tangy tomato basil sauce that cuts the richness of the mozzarella patty so you won't be too overwhelmed when you are feasting on this beauty. KFC's Mozzarella Zinger Double Down truly pushed the envelope on what a conventional burger can be.
.
KFC is having a giveaway where you can stand to win a free Double Down Meal delivered to your doorstep. All you have to do is to tag a friend and leave a comment on why you love this fantastic burger! Good luck and happy feasting!
.
Hereâ€™s how to win:
.
1. Like our post
2. Follow and like @sethluicious and @kfc_sg 
3. Leave a comment telling us why you love the KFC Double Down Burger, and tag a friend! Use the hashtag #SLxKFC.
****
.
Giveaway ends on 22 June 2020 at 11.59pm. Winner will be announced on 23 June 2020 at 11am. Stay tuned to see if you have won. All the best!
.
Terms and conditions:
.
- Your entry will qualify only if the requirements from above are met.
.
- Your account must be public.
.
- Giveaway is only valid for people residing in Singapore.

caption:
Pizza is one of those comfort food that never fails to cheer me up. Cheesy, savoury bites of piping hot Italian goodness - mmm. And in the midst of the current pandemic, Iâ€™m sure we can all do with a little more happiness in our lives.

Todayâ€™s recipe calls for bread, lots of cheese, and some creativity, and just 30 minutes of your time. I went for the classic Hawaiian, with well-caramelised pineapple chunks, a generous amount of ham, topped with lots of cheese and tomato sauce.

Of course, for those of you who are more creative, you can come up with even more innovative pizza toppings. Curry chicken? Thai basil pork? You can put almost anything on this DIY bread pizza. Let us know what creative twists you come up with! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
The omu rice is a simple, hearty dish thatâ€™s super versatile - aside from the rice and eggs, you can really add in any ingredient youâ€™d like to spice things up. Since most of us canâ€™t be away from the laptop for too long, todayâ€™s Japanese Omu Fried Rice will take only 15 minutes to make! Plus, it feeds the whole family.
.
When I say this is a versatile dish, I mean it. You can add minced meat to the fried rice, or switch out the veggies. Not a fan of green bell peppers? Add carrots for bright, bold colours, or even swap it out for cheese, to add a gooey, creamy texture. The possibilities are endless!
.
If you try out this Japanese Omu Fried Rice recipe, let know how it goes! What did you add to your version of it? ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
AJ Delights at Alexandra Food Village is certainly giving high-end bakeries a run for their money. This gem of a hawker stall has been serving up freshly-baked muffins for eight years.
.
Run by a husband-and-wife team, expect flavours such as the ever-popular Apple Streusel Muffin (S$2.50) with a crumbly, buttery top and a fragrant, light-as-air vanilla muffin.
.
Or if you want something a little more indulgent then the Double Chocolat Muffin (S$2) will make all the calories worth it.
.
All you have to do is place an order for AJ Delights' muffins on their website and you'll have one of these boxes in your hands soon enough! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
With the current circumstances, you might not be able to go cafÃ©-hopping just yet, but you can bring @littlefarms into your home.
.
From breakfast goodies to sharing sets perfect for the whole household, thereâ€™s something for everyone here. I really enjoyed the Chicken & Avocado Sourdough (S$14), a hefty sandwich packed with flavour.
.
Sandwiched between two thick slices of fluffy, chewy sourdough, the cheese, tomato and chicken came together beautifully on the palate. Think: savoury, piquant notes, complete with the creamy mouthfeel of melted cheese.
.
A drizzle of honey mustard completed it, adding a zing to this really filling sandwich. Iâ€™m not kidding when I say I couldâ€™ve split this into breakfast and lunch!
.
Little Farms CafÃ© also serves up other breakfast dishes like the Ham & Cheese Croissant, Spinach, Mushroom & Goat Feta Quiche. If youâ€™re ordering for the family, sharing sets like Rotisserie Cajun Chicken Family Set â€“ it comes with a whole roasted chicken!
.
Little Farms CafÃ© offers island-wide delivery of cafÃ©-quality dishes, all made with the highest quality produce. With a minimum order of S$30 and free delivery for orders over S$100, you can indulge in a lovely meal with your family. #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
If you are missing your favourite Sunday brunch meals, well don't fret - @threesacrowdcafe might help tide you over till the Circuit Breaker ends. With nostalgic and familiar flavours, your sweet tooth will certainly be satisfied.
.
One of the waffles to look forward to would certainly have to be the Horlick Waffles (S$9) that's covered with a shower of almond crunch and a dusting of malty Horlicks powder. Crisp on the outside and pillowy in the centre, these waffles looked as good as they taste!
.
No waffles are complete without scoops of ice cream, and Three's A Crowd is known for its unique and special flavours. Their Legacy (S$4.50) is a dark chocolate ice cream that's also a tribute to the late Mr Lee Kuan Yew.
.
Three's A Crowd offers pick-up and delivery, so remember to #tapauplease if you would like a little reminder of Sunday brunch! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Much as I enjoy tinkering about the kitchen, some days Iâ€™d love to take a break from cooking and just dig into a feast. And with @alpinespringcatering, I get to do just that.
.
Can you believe that for just S$68, you can enjoy this sumptuous spread from the Zi Char menu for 5 pax? I have to admit, my family ended up saving the leftovers for dinner too â€“ there was just so much delicious food!
.
The Zi Char menu features staples like Braised Ee Fu Noodles with Baby Abalone and Wok Fried White Pepper Clams, and more unconventional dishes like Signature Salted Egg Yolk Beancurd.
.
But my favourite has got to be our local signature dish, the Chilli Crab (add-on S$15). Drenched in a thick, rich chilli crab sauce that has egg strands in it, this was a massive crab. The crab claws are cracked beforehand, so itâ€™s simply a matter of scooping out the sweet, juicy crabmeat. Truly, the star of the show.
.
If youâ€™re feeling hungry, drop a WhatsApp message to +65 9828 3280 for same-day delivery within 3 hours. Yes, itâ€™s that simple. Order away, and dig in! #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Located at Suntec City, @supersubsingapore first opened its doors to the public in September 2019. The subs came in cardboard boxes which reminded me of those you might spot at a food festival. Each sub came with a side of plain nachos, in case you want to dip into the bountiful toppings sitting atop your sub.
.
Super Sub had a plethora of gourmet options, and I decided to try some of their more famous toppings. Super Subâ€™s Fiery Chic Bolognese (S$7.80) is one of their best-sellers, and for good reason. Topped with lettuce, cherry tomatoes, jalapeno, mayonnaise and cheddar cheese, this tomato-based sub may look rather unassuming at first glance as compared to the others.
.
However, this turned out to be my favourite. The slightly spicy meat sauce was absolutely delicious and it went extremely well with the chicken hotdog. Have you tried hotdog subs in Singapore? ~ @stercei

.
Add a dollop of cream, and a generous serving of jam â€“ youâ€™ve got bakes for a lovely afternoon tea. Donâ€™t forget to brew a pot of piping hot tea to complete the picture. Fluffy and chewy with a crisp top, these scones were lovely indeed.

caption:
Anybody craving some Taiwanese food and a refreshing cup of bubble tea? You can now indulge in the best of both worlds with @emosnackssg. Located at Geylang Road, this eatery boasts a myriad of authentic Taiwanese dishes.
.
If you love heat and you're not afraid to chow down on some dangerously spicy food, dive right into their Mala Chicken (S$4.50). Trust me, you'll be hooked on this tasty and feisty dish. Simple, yet incredibly comforting, relive your memories in Taiwan with their delectable dishes.
.
Be sure to #tapauplease as they are currently offering a 20% discount for self pick-up orders and free islandwide delivery for a minimum purchase of S$55! ~@jermtard

caption:
â€˜Circuit Breakerâ€™ got you feeling down? Turn that frown upside down with yummy fuss-free meals, courtesy of @onandondiners.
.
If youâ€™re too busy to cook or youâ€™d like to treat your family to a scrumptious spread, On & On Diners is here for you with 7 dishes for S$68. caption:
Today, weâ€™re trying out a crowd-favourite recipe that we found on @shermainexk Instagram post. Itâ€™s easy, flaky, and super addictive - this Easy Air Fryer Egg Tarts recipe will have you lining your Tupperware with egg custard pastries for days.
.
I used brown sugar instead of regular white sugar, and the resulting egg tarts had a good amount of caramel smokiness to them. Using frozen prata to replace the typical shortcrust tart shell is certainly a stroke of genius, because it reduces the preparation time by a lot.
.
This recipe makes egg tarts that are closer in taste and texture to Portuguese egg tarts, with a flaky, crispy crust and smooth, egg custard centre. If you have an air fryer at home, pick up a pack of frozen prata from the supermarket and try out this simple recipe. Share your experience with us! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Hidden away at Forum Galleria Orchard Road, @brownbutter.sg sits comfortably between its cousin restaurants, Hana Japanese Restaurant and The Benjamin Browns. Of course, I had to try Brown Butterâ€™s insta-famous desserts. Shaped cheekily like a cartoon block of cheese, I loved the attention to detail with the little holes on the Lemon Cheesecake.
.
Priced at S$8.90+, I felt that it was a little exorbitant for a small slice of cake. The difference between these cakes and other cheesecakes is easily spotted.
.
Instead of having a crunchy biscuit base attached to the cake, these cakes came without a base and sat atop biscuits crumbs scattered in an artfully careless manner. Have you tried the desserts at Brown Butter Cafe yet? ~ @stercei

caption:
[CLOSED] Hereâ€™s a little something to spice up your life. @kebabsfaktory  brings us an all-new flavour: Mala Kebabs. From 29 June 2020, you can turn any kebab into a sizzling hot mala kebab.
.
The Mala Lamb Shawarma was exceptionally fiery â€“ together with the juicy, gamey lamb meat, the tongue-tingling mala spices made me break out in a sweat. You can also get these mala flavours in their Signature Rolls, Salads and Rice Boxes.
.
And for 5 lucky winners, weâ€™ll be giving away S$20 vouchers so that you can enjoy this all-new mala sensation for yourself!
****
Hereâ€™s how to win: 
1. Like our post.
2. Follow @sethluicious and @kebabsfaktory 
3. Comment why youâ€™d like to win the vouchers.
4. Tag a friend!
****
Giveaway ends at 11.59pm on 1 July 2020. Winner will be announced the following day (2 July 2020) at 11am. Stay tuned to see if you have won. All the best!

Feeling in need of something comforting and soothing? Warm yourself up with a piping bowl of frog leg porridge!
.
Fight off the gloom with the sizzling fragrance of tender frog legs immersed in silky, warm porridge. Apart from their immensely comforting congee, @g7liveseafood offers seafood delights and a myriad of zi char dishes.
.
The Marmite Pork Ribs also deserves a mention; crispy ribs coated in a thick sticky, sweet and savoury glaze make this side dish an unbeatable choice. ~ @jermtard

caption:
If you're a fan of pandan cake, good news for you. This soft and fluffy chiffon cake recipe is straight up your alley.
.
Try out our Easy Peasy Pandan Cake recipe, which boasts fluffy and spongy texture. This aromatic cake is my family's all-time favourite dessert. Eat it as an afternoon tea snack or a post-dinner dessert and I'm sure that each mouthful would undoubtedly satisfy your heart and your sweet tooth. ~@jermtard

caption:
Amongst the variety of Malaysian hawker fare at Malaysia Chiak!, my favourite was - hands-down - the Chilly Ban Mian (S$4).
.
Cooked till al dente, the noodles had a nice chewy texture which was perfect when mixed with the minced meat paste, stewed mushrooms and soft boiled egg! ~ @fel_z

caption:
I think you have to agree that there is nothing better than ice cream. Rain or shine, a pint of ice cream is always welcome.
.
This effortless 3-ingredient recipe promises ice cream that's just as good as what you get in the store. I was pretty impressed with how thick, creamy and rich this ice cream turned out - and all without an ice cream maker.
.
Not to mention, the speculoos with its caramel notes was just the icing on the cake - a dream for all the sweet tooths out there. This recipe is so simple and customisable that you can make essentially make any flavour you like.
.
The world is your ice cream flavour, so try this recipe out and tell us what you would make your ice cream with! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Nestled under a block of flats in the quiet estate of Pandan Gardens is @ahhuateochewnoodle.
.
Helmed by a father-daughter team, this is unlike your usual Teochew fishball noodles. Their speciality Homemade Fuzhou Fishball With Rice Needle Noodles (S$3) might be a tad monochromatic but packs huge flavour.
.
Served with rice needle noodles (more commonly known as lao shu fen), a medley of springy fishballs, prized herh kiao and a couple of Ah Hua Teochew Fishball Noodle unique creations, I was slurping every last bit of these noodles.
.
Though not located in the most accessible place, I have to say that Ah Hua Teochew Fishball Noodle will make it worth your while. ~@bunny2302

caption:
When staying at home for an extended period of time gets you down, I'm sure you're like me and seek comfort in food. @thecommunalplace Pancake Tower (S$16) will put a smile on your face instantly with its three-layered fluffy goodness that comes with maple syrup and a generous scattering of cookie crumbles, blueberries, and strawberries.
.
They are thick, and airy, with just the right amount of sweetness, so you won't feel the need to drizzle too much maple syrup just to enjoy it! If you haven't tried them yet, order today with their islandwide delivery service and current 2-for-1 promotion. ~ @waniology

caption:
Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry Rice puts all other Hainanese curry rice stalls to shame. A luscious and satisfying curry that's messily ladled over a plate of rice, this hits the spot alright. It's a little thinner than most curry dishes but twice as good.
.
Another item that you have to get on your plate is Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry Rice's Crispy Pork. These moreish rashers are crispy to a fault and dangerously addictive, providing a delightful savoury crunch to pair with your rice.
.
Besides the Crispy Pork, Beo Crescent Hainanese Curry also has fantastic meat and vegetable selections that are just as good! At an affordable price point, No Name Hainanese Curry Rice surely lives up to its name, or lack thereof. ~@ bunny2302

caption:
Dalgona coffee is a bonafide hit of 2020; even more so with its fluffy and velvety smooth texture. This time, we'll be taking things up a notch. Inspired by the viral drink, we have made a no-churn version of Dalgona-inspired Ice Cream loaded with delicious toffee bits. .
A memorable treat you won't soon forget, this combination is a match made in heaven. Rich, creamy and decadent, the ice cream melts in your mouth with mellow sweetness and a deep coffee flavour.
.
Coupled with a hint of caramel crunchiness from the toffee bits, I'm sure this dessert will "mocha" you crazy! ~ @jermtard

caption:
In the Whampoa Makan Place, there's a gem that is replete with history. @matasohsg dates back to the 1950s, where hawker life was as rustic as it gets.
.
With handmade fishball and meatballs that are made with 100% yellowtail fish, that makes all the difference, trust me. Their Soh Special (S$4.50/S$5.50) is worth the trip down. A wobbly onsen egg, al dente noodles coupled with those springy and bouncy fishballs - it's a perfect meal if I do say so myself. Make the trip down to Whampoa Makan Place and try it out for yourself! ~@bunny2302

caption:
Impress your friends and family with one of @bobthebakerboyâ€™s out-of-the-box cake designs, like this Defying Gravity Floating Beer Can Cake (from S$138). You can add on tiers, change the colour and the brand as well as the flavour of the cake itself, according to your fancy. But most importantly, itâ€™s one of the best-tasting cakes Iâ€™ve had in a long time!
.
This one was made with Belgian Chocolate and the layers were moist and soft, without overwhelming the tastebuds. Their cakes are also made with lower sugar, so itâ€™s healthier than your regular store-bought cake. Take it from me, as someone who canâ€™t get enough of cake; this one is a treat youâ€™ll want to take your time to savour! #sp ~@waniology

caption:
@lovehandleburgers isn't just any vegan burger spot; their burgers start from only S$10 and are packed with bold flavours - not something you'd expect from a vegan place.
.
Their Double Cheeseburger (S$17) consists of two layers of Impossibleâ„¢ patties, two slices of melted vegan cheese, caramelised onions, burger sauce, and pickles. The homemade brioche buns remained exceptionally firm, despite the journey during delivery.
.
Sink your teeth into one of the creations now, as they're available for islandwide delivery with only a S$10 delivery fee! Note that there's S$30 minimum spending. ~ @waniology

caption:
For most of us working professionals, a cup of coffee is never far from our caffeine-dependent hands. As a coffee fiend who canâ€™t do without my daily cuppa, I was delighted to takethe Bootstrap Mix Pack (S$35) from @bootstrapcoldbrewsg for a spin.
.
My favourite drink from the pack had to be the Bootstrap Cold Brew Milk & Manuka Honey. The manuka honey brought out the velvety smooth sweetness in the coffee and milk, and smoothed over most of the bitter edge from the coffee.
.
This is a classic white coffee, but with a twist. Bootstrap Beveragesâ€™ signature cold brew comes with creamy 100% fresh milk, and the floral sweetness of organic New Zealand manuka honey - it has natural healing properties!
.
Coffee or tea, Bootstrap Beveragesâ€™ cold brewing technique certainly brings out the best in the beans and leaves. Ready for an awesome perk-me-up? #sp ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
In the gleaming white-washed walls of Maxwell Chambers sits @dumplings.ru , a Russian restaurant serving authentic Russian delights that are sure to charm you.
.
Well, if you are a little nervous about diving headfirst into the depth of Russian cuisine don't worry, these colourful dumplings are a wonderful introduction. With robust and tasty filling such as beef, lamb and even potato and bacon, these are simply scrumptious.
.
Perfect for lunch and dinner, you can even dip your toes and order a Ukrainian Borscht (S$8.50) while you're at it. Fusion Dumplings puts on no airs and trust me, you'll find yourself liking Russian food before you know it! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
Out of eggs? You can still make a chocolatey dessert, with this Mayonnaise Chocolate Cake recipe. The thought of putting savoury mayonnaise in sweet chocolate cake might seem really gross to most, but I gave it a try to see how it turns out.
.
This cake is much fluffier, with a decent crumb pattern that made it like a chocolatey sponge cake. Itâ€™s a little stickier on the bottom, almost like sticky date pudding.
.
The baking does yield a rather large cake, but you canâ€™t ever have too much chocolate cake, after all. Share the love with your family and friends - and maybe only reveal the secret ingredient to them after theyâ€™ve showered you with praises for your baking prowess.
.
If youâ€™re intrigued by this recipe, why not give it a try? Let us know if this strange ingredient substitution works for you too. ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
If you like zi char, then you've probably heard about @kengengkee. A household name, you'll know you're in for a good time when you order from KEK Seafood, so I ordered their Family Set D (S$116) that's good for four to six people.
.
The highlight of the set has to be their signature Moonlight Hor Fun that came with moon-like egg yolks intact when delivered, poised in the middle of the fried noodles. Break the egg and you'll get hor fun covered in a velvety, silky sauce with moreish, fatty slices of lap cheong and lard.
.
Other dishes I would recommend would be the Coffee Ribs and the Salted Egg Prawns. Moreover, KEK Seafood is so generous with their portions you'll have yummy leftovers for days. Order up a feast from KEK Seafood and trust me you won't be disappointed! ~ @bunny2302

caption:
For those with a sweet tooth and canâ€™t resist desserts, youâ€™ve probably been spending your time baking, and indulging in your bakes. Banana bread, sourdough and cookies aside, sometimes you want to treat yourself to something thatâ€™s a little more decadent.
.
Try out this recipe for @milosingapore Bread â€œTiramisuâ€ that you can make in just 30 minutes!
.

caption:

Well, to save us the heartache of pining for this seasonal burger, hereâ€™s a recipe for DIY McDonaldâ€™s Prosperity Burger, in just 30 minutes!
.
While the sliced onions are added raw, like how McDonaldâ€™s does it, feel free to grill the onions very lightly if thatâ€™s your preference. Personally, I find the sharp, pungent bite from raw sliced onions provides an additional dimension to the burger.

caption:
Those of us who enjoy Asian desserts would be used to sweet potatoes. From sweet potato sesame balls, to bubur cha cha, these starchy roots add lots of chewy bite to our favourite sweet treats.
.
Letâ€™s explore a different side of desserts and sweet treats, with Anthony Bourdainâ€™s Candied Sweet Potatoes with Bourbon.
.
Together with the bourbon sauce, it was an absolute delight. The butter and sugar in the sauce left a creamy mouthfeel, while a hint of tartness from the apple cider played on my palate. The alcohol content from the bourbon and cider wouldâ€™ve burnt off during the cooking process, so all thatâ€™s left of the bourbon was mostly deep notes of caramel, vanilla and molasses.
.
Try it, and let us know how it goes! ~ @colourmemamused

caption:
Some days you donâ€™t want fancy burgers going for S$15 a pop. You just want a no-frills, down-to-earth burger. Patty, bun, condiments; the three most important aspects that make or break a burger.

Craving cheap but good burgers, I was delighted to discover @zippbnp, located at Amoy Street Food Centre.

Starting off strong with the Hamburger (S$5.70/single patty, S$8.70/double patty), this was a burger that I couldnâ€™t wait to sink my teeth into. Even though I got the single patty burger, the 150g handmade patty was already so thick that it took a little effort to fit in my mouth---I can hardly imagine what the double patty would be like!

Zipp Burger & Pasta is truly one of those hidden gems, but now that the catâ€™s out of the bag, youâ€™ll know where you can get excellent, scrumptious burgers. Whatâ€™s your go-to spot for burgers? ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
Whip up your very own Canadian dish at home during this #StayHome period with our homemade Canadian Poutine recipe!

Using ingredients we can find in Singapore, this is probably as authentic as it gets. Seeing the end product was absolutely satisfying for me because I loved every aspect of the dish. The way the warm, dark, ambrosial gravy trickled down the fries and chunks of cheese whetted my appetite as soon as I poured the gravy over this delightful meal.

I especially liked how the heat of the gravy melted the cheese, making it look appetising and stringy. The fries were cooked to a crisp golden-brown and I was glad I decided to cook them without peeling the potato skin.

Have you tried Canadian poutine before? ~ @stercei

caption:
What if I told you that you, too, could cook and bake like famous chefs? We may not be able to match his skill in crafting intricate desserts, but at least we can put together this easy yet scrumptious chocolate cake, as seen from @pierrehermeofficialâ€™s Instagram post.

Pierre HermÃ©â€™s 5-Ingredient Chocolate Cake recipe is simple enough, and yields an absolutely heavenly cake. Imagine the soft, crumbly texture of butter cookies, but with the rich, decadent bittersweet notes of dark chocolate.

You might even want to pair your chocolate cake with the most classic of accompaniments: vanilla ice cream. Creamy and cold to the warm and crumbly chocolate cake, this is sure to sate even the direst dessert cravings.

If you leave it in the fridge overnight, it gets a lot denser and more fudgey. Mmm, delicious.

Want to feel like a famous pastry chef for a day? Try this 5-Ingredient Chocolate Cake recipe, and share your experience with us! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
[GIVEAWAY] There is no better news than hearing that KFC's Zinger Double Down has returned to us and even better, it's back with a twist. Presenting: the Mozzarella Zinger Double Down that features the same tantalising Zinger fillets but this time with a chunky, golden mozzarella patty in between. That's not all, these Zinger fillets are slathered with a tangy tomato basil sauce that cuts the richness of the mozzarella patty so you won't be too overwhelmed when you are feasting on this beauty. KFC's Mozzarella Zinger Double Down truly pushed the envelope on what a conventional burger can be.
.
KFC is having a giveaway where you can stand to win a free Double Down Meal delivered to your doorstep. All you have to do is to tag a friend and leave a comment on why you love this fantastic burger! Good luck and happy feasting!
.
Hereâ€™s how to win:
.
1. Like our post
2. Follow and like @sethluicious and @kfc_sg 
3. Leave a comment telling us why you love the KFC Double Down Burger, and tag a friend! Use the hashtag #SLxKFC.
****
.
Giveaway ends on 22 June 2020 at 11.59pm. Winner will be announced on 23 June 2020 at 11am. Stay tuned to see if you have won. All the best!
.
Terms and conditions:
.
- Your entry will qualify only if the requirements from above are met.
.
- Your account must be public.
.
- Giveaway is only valid for people residing in Singapore.

caption:
Pizza is one of those comfort food that never fails to cheer me up. Cheesy, savoury bites of piping hot Italian goodness - mmm. And in the midst of the current pandemic, Iâ€™m sure we can all do with a little more happiness in our lives.

Todayâ€™s recipe calls for bread, lots of cheese, and some creativity, and just 30 minutes of your time. I went for the classic Hawaiian, with well-caramelised pineapple chunks, a generous amount of ham, topped with lots of cheese and tomato sauce.

Of course, for those of you who are more creative, you can come up with even more innovative pizza toppings. Curry chicken? Thai basil pork? You can put almost anything on this DIY bread pizza. Let us know what creative twists you come up with! ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
The omu rice is a simple, hearty dish thatâ€™s super versatile - aside from the rice and eggs, you can really add in any ingredient youâ€™d like to spice things up. Since most of us canâ€™t be away from the laptop for too long, todayâ€™s Japanese Omu Fried Rice will take only 15 minutes to make! Plus, it feeds the whole family.
.
When I say this is a versatile dish, I mean it. You can add minced meat to the fried rice, or switch out the veggies. Not a fan of green bell peppers? Add carrots for bright, bold colours, or even swap it out for cheese, to add a gooey, creamy texture. The possibilities are endless!
.
If you try out this Japanese Omu Fried Rice recipe, let know how it goes! What did you add to your version of it? ~ @colourmeamused

caption:
AJ Delights at Alexandra Food Village is certainly giving high-end bakeries a run for their money. This gem of a hawker stall has been serving up freshly-baked muffins for eight years.
.
Run by a husband-and-wife team, expect flavours such as the ever-popular Apple Streusel Muffin (S$2.50) with a crumbly, buttery top and a fragrant, light-as-air vanilla muffin.
.
Or if you want something a little more indulgent then the Double Chocolat Muffin (S$2) will make all the calories worth it.
.
All you have to do is place an order for AJ Delights' muffins on their website and you'll have one of these boxes in your hands soon enough! ~ @bunny2302
